name: Sensodyne Pronamel Gentle Teeth Whitening Enamel Toothpaste for Sensitive Teeth, to Reharden and Strengthen Enamel, Amazon Exclusive, Fresh Mint - 4 Ounces (Pack of 3)

other_info.Material Type Free: Dye Free, Triclosan Free, Sulfate Free, Paraben Free

about_this_item: Three tubes of Fresh Mint flavored Sensodyne Pronamel Gentle Whitening Enamel Toothpaste for Sensitive Teeth
#1 Dentist Recommended toothpaste for Protecting and Strengthening Enamel
Exclusive fresh mint flavor provides a refreshing feeling to your teeth
Enamel strengthening toothpaste that offers effective protection against cavities
Teeth whitening toothpaste specially formulated to gently polish away stains

title: Firm hold
content: I was advised against buying this product. I was said not to hold the phone firmly. But was pleasantly suprised. It holds my phone perfectly, even with the thick back phone cover. I placed it in the vent. The adhesive option still pending as I fixed the base and waiting for it to adhere to the surface properly because the weather is really hot, I'll wait more than the instructed 24 hours to be on the safe side. With the button at the back I can easily release the phone without having to yank it. You can see on the picture that it's a large phone too.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: The reason I use this is it has no irritating SLS foaming agent, which causes canker sores. That's terrific. Now, the mfr. just needs to indicate the presence or absence of SLS on the outside packaging and the tube. They also make some Sensodyne products that DO have SLS, and their naming scheme is confusing as heck. So either designate another sub-brand name for each variety, or clearly indicate SLS or not on the package. If they have room on the label to tell you to turn off the faucet while you brush, they have room to say "Contains No SLS" or "Contains SLS."
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This particular toothpaste is rated really well when it comes to its abrasiveness. I am highly conscious of how abrasive toothpastes can be, because once you wear down your tooth enamel, you don't get to restore it. I have done quite a bit of research to find the best toothpaste possible when it comes to abrasiveness, ingredients, performance, taste, and what the toothpaste can actually accomplish over time. This is by far the best I can find. This will continue to be my go-to toothpaste. In my opinion, nothing beats it at the moment. It's pricey, but with toothpaste, you get what you pay for.
